medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent herpes with worsening patches and hyperpigmentation in a preterm infant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Herpes was identified scattered all over the body after birth. The condition worsened and fused into patches, leading to warty crusting and hyperpigmentation. On day 30, the infant exhibited a marked decrease in milk intake, poor response, and apnea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The infant was born preterm at 36+2 weeks gestation and was small for gestational age. Prenatal use of magnesium sulfate and full course of steroids was noted. Parents denied any history of genetic disease.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents are healthy and not consanguineous, with no known family history of genetic diseases.
